statements.name: PROC SANDWICH
statements.help:
PROC SANDWICH <options>;                 
	BY  variables;                 
	CLASS  variable <(options)>...<variable <(options)>></ global-options>;                 
	CLUSTER  variables;                 
	DISPLAY <table-list></ options>;                 
	DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                 
	FREQ  variable;                 
	MODEL dependent=<effects> / <model-options>;                 
	WEIGHT  variable;

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC SANDWICH to use

arguments.name: SPARSE
arguments.description: invokes the sparse matrix techniques in the analytic computations

statements.name: BY
statements.description: produces separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the BY variables

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: names the classification variables to be used as explanatory variables in the analysis

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: reverses the sort order

arguments.name: MISSING
arguments.description: treats missing values as valid levels

arguments.name: ORDER=
arguments.description: specifies the sort order for the levels

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: external formatted values

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: descending frequency count

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: unformatted value

arguments.name: PARAM=
arguments.description: specifies the parameterization of the variable

arguments.name: EFFECT
arguments.description: Effect coding

arguments.name: GLM
arguments.description: Less-than-full-rank reference cell coding (global-option only)

arguments.name: ORDINAL
arguments.description: Cumulative parameterization for an ordinal CLASS variable

arguments.name: POLYNOMIAL
arguments.description: Polynomial coding

arguments.name: REFERENCE
arguments.description: Reference cell coding

arguments.name: ORTHORDINAL
arguments.description: Orthogonalizes PARAM=ORDINAL coding

arguments.name: ORTHPOLY
arguments.description: Orthogonalizes PARAM=POLYNOMIAL coding

arguments.name: ORTHREF
arguments.description: Orthogonalizes PARAM=REFERENCE coding

arguments.name: REF=
arguments.description: specifies the reference level of the variable

arguments.name: 'level'
arguments.description: specifies the level of the variable to use as the reference level.

arguments.name: FIRST
arguments.description: designates the first ordered level as the reference

arguments.name: LAST
arguments.description: designates the last ordered level as reference

arguments.name: SPLIT
arguments.description: splits levels of CLASS variables into independent effects

statements.name: CLUSTER
statements.description: specifies one or more variables in the DATA= input data table that identify the clusters

statements.name: DISPLAY
statements.description: enables you to specify a list of display tables to display or exclude

arguments.name: CASESENSITIVE
arguments.description: performs a case-sensitive comparison of table names in the table-list to display table names when tables are subsetted for display

arguments.name: EXCLUDE
arguments.description: displays all display tables except those that you specify in the table-list

arguments.name: EXCLUDEALL
arguments.description: suppresses display of all tables

arguments.name: TRACE
arguments.description: displays the display table names, labels, and paths

statements.name: DISPLAYOUT
statements.description: enables you to create output tables from your displayed output
statements.help:
DISPLAYOUT  table-spec-list </ options>;                                              
table-spec-list specifies a list of output tables in key=value or key format                     
key=value specifies key as the ODS table name, path, or partial pathname, and value as the output table name                     
key is the ODS table name and the output table name

arguments.name: INCLUDEALL
arguments.description: creates output tables for all display tables

arguments.name: NOREPLACE
arguments.description: does not replace any existing output table of the same name

arguments.name: REPEATED
arguments.description: replicates all output tables on all nodes

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: identifies a numeric variable in the input data table that contains the frequency of occurrence of each observation

statements.name: MODEL
statements.description: names the dependent variable and the explanatory effects, including covariates, main effects, interactions, and nested effects
statements.help:
MODEL dependent=<effects> / <model-options>;                                              
dependent is the dependent variable

arguments.name: dependent
arguments.description: specifies the dependent (response) variable

arguments.name: NOINT
arguments.description: specifies to suppress the intercept term that is otherwise included in the model

arguments.name: SS3
arguments.description: specifies to display a "Model Anova" table that contains tests that are computed by using Type III sums of squares for each effect

arguments.name: effects
arguments.description: specifies the explanatory effects

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: variable is used to weight each observation to perform a weighted analysis of the data
